pages.text: Anchiornis huxleyi is a small, feathered dinosaur from the Late Jurassic period, approximately 160 million years ago. Discovered in China, Anchiornis is known for its well-preserved fossil specimens that provide valuable insights into the evolution of feathers and flight in theropod dinosaurs. With a body length of around 50 centimeters and a wingspan of 60-70 centimeters, Anchiornis was likely an arboreal species that used its feathered limbs for gliding and climbing in forested environments.
